content: Lifestyle General Asked by Xinyi LumAsked on 14 May 2019Thoughts on paying for Carousell coins to bump your listings?$1.48 - 148 coins$19.98 - 1,998 coins$148 - 16,305 coinsWould love to hear if anyone has built a large brand/following via selling on Carousell too :)3 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (3)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 14 May 2019No way....impossible to win those blogshops, webshops.....I gave up on carousell already. Very hard for users to find products with shops full time spamming listings0 comments2

Junus EuTop Contributor (Sep)Level 8. WizardAnswered on 16 May 2019I wouldn't. Personally I don't have that many items to sell, so if someone is looking for what I have to sell, they would find it via the search bar already.0 comments1

YF ChuaLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 14 May 2019Last time bump your listings feature is free. After carousell start to charge user for the bump i have stop using it. It just like letting carousell draw a portion of your profit from the item that you sell.It also look no point to pay an amount to put your item in the front listing, if your item is popular that many people will search for it. To me it is just tactic for carousell to survive.0 comments1
